intro: Greenovia rupifraga, commonly known as the mountain rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
